page.title: 04Education _ Primary Schools
page.content: There is a Primary School in School Rd., Tendring. It was built in 1896. It is a red brick building, typical of a village School of its time, and with several later outbuildings. It has about 150 pupils aged between 5 & 11. They have a lot of space around them. There are climbing frames for the children to play on. In the middle of the ground is a disused air-raid shed which belongs to the Ministry of Defence so the School does not use it except for roses growing up the walls. In 1977 the children planted 10 trees to commemorate the Queen's Silver Jubilee - all but one, replanted with a conifer, are growing well. There is a plot for wild life studies which was once used for growing vegetables for the School kitchen. The Head, who is retiring soon, hopes to have a pond dug for ecological studies.{
